sect1.title: Synopsis
sect1.para: On this page, the user can define characteristics for the integrated workflow component, for example a name and version or some information about the tool integrator.

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Define some characteristics for the integrated workflow. Required fields are Name and Version. All other fields are optional.

listitem.para: Name*: Required field that defines the name of the component after integration. The integrated workflow component is displayed with this name in the palette view. Note that the name must not contain special characters. Furthermore the name will not be accepted if there is another locally integrated tool or workflow component with the same name.

Version*: Required field to define a version for your integrated workflow component. If components with the same name were integrated by other users in the network, they can be distinguished by the version. When executing a workflow the user can select the desired component version from a dropdown menu.

Icon Path: Select an icon for the workflow component. At best, it is larger than 32x32 pixels and has the same width and height. To avoid an absolute path link to the icon, select to copy it into the configuration folder.
Group Path: Define a path here under which the workflow component is displayed in the palette view. Subgroups can be seperated by "/".

Documentation Path: Add a documentation file for the workflow component. Note that the file must be a PDF or a TXT document and it must not be greater than 50 MB. The documentation will be copied into the configuration folder during integration.
Description: Provide a description of the workflow component, that can be seen by other users in the network when using the component in a workflow.

Limit parallel execution: Here you can limit the number of parallel executions of the workflow component. If this number is reached any further calls of the component will wait until a prior call is finished. This can be useful when you have restricted licenses for running the component or ressource restriction is desired.
Name: Specify a contact name of the tool integrator.
E-mail: Provide contact information if someone has questions or wants to make suggestions about the integrated workflow component.
